intro: Dutaillyea longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed Dutaillyea, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, Dutaillyea longipes is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
